alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 6:52PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...TSUNAMI ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR COASTAL DEL NORTE COUNTY... ...TSUNAMI ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR COASTAL DEL NORTE COUNTY... * UPDATES...WAVE AMPLITUDES CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY DECREASE, BUT REMAIN ABOVE ADVISORY LEVEL AT THIS TIME. * LOCAL IMPACTS...A TSUNAMI CAPABLE OF PRODUCING STRONG CURRENTS THAT MAY BE HAZARDOUS TO SWIMMERS...BOATS...AND COASTAL STRUCTURES IS OCCURRING. WIDESPREAD INUNDATION IS NOT EXPECTED. * RECOMMENDED ACTIONS...If you are located in this coastal area...move off the beach and out of harbors and marinas. Do not go to the coast to watch the tsunami. Be alert to instructions from your local emergency officials * FORECAST TSUNAMI START TIMES...A TSUNAMI SURGE IS ONGOING ALONG THE COAST OF DEL NORTE COUNTY. Tsunamis often arrive as a series of waves or surges which could be dangerous for many hours after the first wave arrival. The first tsunami wave or surge may not be the highest in the series. * FORECAST TSUNAMI DURATION...HAZARDOUS CURRENTS AND WAVES WILL REMAIN POSSIBLE THROUGH THIS EVENING. * OBSERVED TSUNAMI WAVE HEIGHTS FROM EARLIER... CRESCENT CITY... 3.7 FEET. * PRELIMINARY SOURCE INFORMATION...A VOLCANIC ERUPTION OCCURRED AT 827 PM PST ON JAN 14TH IN THE SOUTH PACIFIC OCEAN. A TSUNAMI WAS GENERATED BY THE ERUPTION. * TIDE INFORMATION... Crescent City Harbor...Low tides of 3.9 ft at 407 AM on JANUARY 16TH and -0.3 ft at 515 PM on JANUARY 16TH. High tide of 7.4 ft at 957 AM on JANUARY 16TH. This product will be updated as new information becomes available. Stay tuned to your local news source and NOAA weather radio for further information and updates.
